description: Photographs from Arizona, Sudan and India.

title: Tom Who? Ryan Says Revis Is Best Player in Football
description: Anyone in Patriots camp waiting for bulletin-board material in advance of this weeks Round 3 showdown against the Jets got it hand-delivered on Monday. (Were you really surprised it took this long?)

title: Irans Ghotbi Speaks  in English
description: DOHA, Qatar  Iran, Iraq and North Korea  the Axis of Evil, in the words of former President George W. Bush  all play first-round matches on Tuesday at the Asian Cup.

title: Tim Hetheringtons Disquieting Diary
description: The documentarian Tim Hetherington is no stranger to the readers of Lens, who have seen accounts of his book Infidel and his film Restrepo, concerning an American platoon in the Korengal Valley in Afghanistan; and the book Long Story Bit by Bit: Liberia Retold and the short film Liberian Graffiti. Its easy to wonder how Mr. Hetherington manages to shuttle between home in a global capital like New York  where he is a contributing photographer to Vanity Fair  and outposts where the world seems forever at war with itself.

title: Living Like the Pros at Vanderbilt
description: I hope everyone had a wonderful holiday season. I got everything I wanted, including a nice cardigan sweater and a new cookbook. What I didnt get however, were the new Beats by Dre headphones, which were apparently the must-have gift of the season, judging by the fact that every guy on the team seems to now have a pair. Who needs a radio anyway?

title: The Disrobing of a Naked Tesla Sedan
description: The wags were out prior to the Tesla press conference Monday at the Detroit auto show, wondering if the bare Model S chassis on display was intentional  or was it accidentally left outside and stripped by car thieves?

title: Tallying Up the First Merger Monday of 2011
description: Deal makers are kicking the year off with a bang.

title: A Light in India
description: When we hear the word innovation, we often think of new technologies or silver bullet solutions  like hydrogen fuel cells or a cure for cancer. To be sure, breakthroughs are vital: antibiotics and vaccines, for example, transformed global health. But as weve argued in Fixes, some of the greatest advances come from taking old ideas or technologies and making them accessible to millions of people who are underserved.

title: Afghanistan Aid Overseer Resigns
description: The American official who is responsible for overseeing how the billions of dollars in American aid to Afghanistan are spent has resigned, the White House said.

title: Washington and Arizona React to Tucson Tragedy
description: An outpouring of grief could be seen in Arizona and Washington, D.C., on Monday as people reacted to the shooting on Saturday that left six people dead and 14 others wounded.

title: Labor Board Overturns Vote by Sandwich Shop Workers
description: The National Labor Relations Board on Monday announced a settlement that sets aside an Oct. 22 election in which workers at 10 Jimmy Johns sandwich shops in the Minneapolis area voted 87 to 85 against joining the Industrial Workers of the World.

title: To Understand Assassination Threat, Look Beyond Tucson
description: Word of the attempted assassination of Representative Gabrielle Giffords outside a Tucson supermarket, which left her in critical condition after a bullet passed through her brain, had barely broken before speculation erupted on the motivations of the man accused of shooting her and killing six others, Jared Lee Loughner, 22.

title: Live Analysis: Auburn 22, Oregon 19
description: Live analysis and coverage of the Bowl Championship Series title game between Auburn and Oregon. This game promises to feature plenty of offense, with the Heisman Trophy-winning quarterback Cam Newton leading Auburn and Oregon featuring a fast-paced offensive attack that has left opponents gasping for breath  and doing some acting  this season.

title: Satisfied With Defense, the Rangers Deal for a Young Forward
description: The Rangers cast their lot with their young defense corps and shored up their injury-depleted cast of forwards Monday by trading the veteran defenseman Michal Rozsival to Phoenix for left wing Wojtek Wolski.

title: Top Harbinger Official Leaves to Start Own Firm
description: After more than eight years working beside Philip A. Falcone, the embattled hedge manager of Harbinger Capital Partners, Lawrence Clark, a top investment manager at the firm, confirmed on Monday that he had left to start his own fund.

title: A Resurgent Chrysler Says It Is Here to Stay
description: DETROIT  A year ago, Chrysler didnt have a single new vehicle to display at its hometown auto show, and rival executives were taking bets on how long the smallest and most troubled of Detroits three automakers would last.

title: H.P. Offers Experts for One-Day Tech Support
description: On Tuesday, Hewlett-Packard will put engineers, designers and high-level employees online for Expert Day, a 24-hour period where they will answer your thorniest technical questions, even for products that are out of warranty and no longer supported.

title: A Place on the Sex-Offender Registry for a Crime That May Be Off the Books
description: WASHINGTON

title: Belichick: Hes No Ryan
description: New England Patriots Coach Bill Belichick would probably sooner cut out his tongue than match Jets Coach Rex Ryan barb for barb. But on Monday, the reticent Belichick got a laugh from the voluble Ryans contention that Sundays A.F.C. divisional game between the rivals is really Ryan versus Belichick.

title: Falling for Years, Abortion Rate Levels Off, With More Choosing Medication Over Surgery
description: The abortion rate in the United States, which has declined steadily since a 1981 peak of more than 29 abortions per 1,000 women, stalled between 2005 and 2008, at slightly less than 20 abortions per 1,000 women, according to a new report from the Guttmacher Institute.

title: Human-Trafficking Suspect Is Arrested While Gambling
description: A Queens woman suspected of involvement in a human-trafficking ring that smuggled young Korean women into the United States and forced them into prostitution in New York and elsewhere on the East Coast was arrested while gambling at a casino in Connecticut, immigration officials said Monday.

title: Revis Is Waiting, but Passers Steer Clear
description: For four quarters, Jets cornerback Darrelle Revis schooled Reggie Wayne in the loneliest number, as reflected in Waynes statistics. The Colts threw one pass to Wayne. He caught one pass. For 1 yard.

title: On Walking, Chewing Gum, and Saying Sorry
description: No senior officials in the Bloomberg administration chewed gum on Monday as they walked into a City Council hearing on their bungled management of the post-Christmas blizzard. This was a wise move on their part. By their own admission, the walk-chew balance at City Hall is out of kilter right now.

title: The Weapon and the Laws
description: The gunman was using a 33-round magazine, which is banned in six states and the District of Columbia, but not in Arizona, which has among the most permissive gun laws.

title: Abe Lincoln and Filibuster Fever
description: These days the word filibuster brings to mind long-winded debates and congressional paralysis. But in January 1861, a very different use of the term occupied the mind of Abraham Lincoln.

title: Shooting Suspect Was Calm During Cab Ride to Supermarket, His Driver Reports
description: TUCSON  Jared L. Loughner wanted change back from a $20 bill that he used to pay for a taxi ride to a Safeway store here, according to the manager of the taxi company.

title: 8 Die From Latest Flooding in Australia
description: SYDNEY, Australia  At least 8 people were killed and 72 others were missing after raging flood waters overturned cars and demolished buildings during an overnight downpour in Queensland State, the Australian police said Tuesday.

title: Obama to Go to Tucson
description: President Obama will travel to Arizona on Wednesday to attend a memorial service in Tucson, a White House official said Monday. The president will also visit the family of Ms. Giffords and other victims, the official said, and likely deliver his first expansive public remarks since the shooting rampage.

Kellys Playbook Is Becoming Required Reading at High Schools
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  Based on foot traffic from high school coaches to Eugene, Ore., expect the hyper-tempo, no-huddle spread offenses used by No. 1 Auburn and No. 2 Oregon to spread.

description: Sixty children in a first-grade class can get loud  sometimes too loud for a teacher to explain a lesson.

description: I hope the only people harmed are speculators.

title: Wal-Mart Will Skip Hearing by Council
description: As Wal-Mart battles to open its first stores in New York City, the City Council will hold a hearing on Wednesday on the possible impact to local businesses and communities.

title: Wall Collapse at Queens Construction Site Kills One Worker and Injures Three
description: A cinder-block wall collapsed at a construction site in Queens on Monday morning, killing a 26-year-old worker and seriously injuring one of his brothers and two other workers, according to city officials and a neighbor of the victims family.

title: South Snarled by Second Snowstorm in Weeks
description: ATLANTA As four inches of powdery snow coated the city, aides to Georgias new governor debated until the last minute whether to cancel Mondays black-tie inauguration ball and ask the Motown cover band to pack up their instruments.

title: 60 Students Per Class
description: A day in the life of a school in Crown Heights.

title: Palin, Amid Criticism, Stays in Electronic Comfort Zone
description: Under criticism that her political rhetoric had helped create a climate for political violence, Sarah Palin addressed the issue in trademark fashion: via e-mail to the conservative commentator Glenn Beck.

title: Caring for Her Mother, Through It All
description: On Christmas Eve, while bringing her mother soup as she lay in the hospital recovering from surgery, Odette Lupis slipped on some ice in the street and broke her wrist.

title: Judges Berate Bank Lawyers in Foreclosures
description: With judges looking ever more critically at home foreclosures, they are reaching beyond the bankers to heap some of their most scorching criticism on the lawyers.

title: Cookie Gilchrist, Early Star of the A.F.L., Dies at 75
description: Cookie Gilchrist, the Buffalo Bills hard-charging fullback who became one of the early stars of the American Football League, died Monday in Pittsburgh. He was 75.

title: Companion Is Charged in Killing of Journalist in a Times Square Hotel
description: The 21-year-old companion of a Portuguese celebrity journalist who was choked and beaten to death in his Times Square hotel room on Friday has been charged with one count of second-degree murder in his death, the police said on Monday.

title: Looking Up at Opponents Leaves Knicks Feeling Empty Inside
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Deep teams, quality ones built to win championships, have strong frontcourts or at least one overpowering force. They pose problems for a player the caliber of Amare Stoudemire, a natural power forward.

title: City Officials Admit Mistakes in Response to Blizzard
description: The Bloomberg administration on Monday admitted to a host of errors in its handling of the paralyzing snowstorm last month, describing a lack of preparation, confused lines of authority and an ignorance of on-the-ground conditions.

title: Player of the Year, From a Team of Many Choices
description: LONDON

title: In Giffordss District, a Long History of Tension
description: This article was reported by Sam Dolnick, Katharine Q. Seelye and  Adam Nagourney and written by Mr. Nagourney.

title: The South, Wreathed in White
description: Snow piled 4 inches in Atlanta, 11 inches in Tennessee and a foot in North Carolina.

title: Flakes May Not Pile Up, but the Anxiety Will
description: Time was, clouds gathered over the frigid city and released moisture that fell to the land not in liquid form, but in a semi-hardened state that the people called snow. The people waited for the snow to stop falling, and they worked to clear enough from the roads so as to access without interruption institutions of commerce, entertainment and worship. This period of snowfall was called winter.

title: In Detroit, Toyota Vows to Earn Trust
description: DETROIT  The auto show here this week is shaping up to be a celebration of the American car industrys resurgence. But the appearance on Monday of Akio Toyoda, the Toyota president and grandson of the Japanese carmakers founder, was a reminder that the biggest foreign player in the American market is refusing to be counted out.

title: In Shootings Wake, ESPN Sticks to Script
description: ESPN proceeded with its regular pregame programming before Oregon and Auburn played Monday night in the Bowl Championship Series title game in Glendale, Ariz., despite the shootings on Saturday in Tucson that left 6 dead and 14 wounded.

title: Tuesday: Guest at the Party
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  What reaction do you usually get if you dare to share your fondness for crossword puzzles with others at cocktail parties? One of the most frequent comments I get when I tell people that I construct puzzles is, Oh, I can never do those, followed immediately by, Who ate all the dip? I cant help it; I like dip. But that is not my point.

title: AT&T and Verizon Trade Taunts Over iPhone
description: In the Verizon-AT&T fight, the gloves are officially off.

title: The Politicized Mind
description: Before he allegedly went off on his shooting rampage in Tucson, Jared Loughner listed some of his favorite books on his YouTube page. These included: Animal Farm, Brave New World, Alice in Wonderland, One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest, Through the Looking Glass and The Communist Manifesto. Many of these books share a common theme: individuals trying to control their own thoughts and government or some other force trying to take that control away.

title: Congress Weighs Enhanced Security Plan
description: This article is by Eric Lipton, Charlie Savage and Jennifer Steinhauer.

title: A Flood Tide of Murder
description: By all means, condemn the hateful rhetoric that has poured so much poison into our political discourse. The crazies dont kill in a vacuum, and the vilest of our political leaders and commentators deserve to be called to account for their demagoguery and the danger that comes with it. But thats the easy part.

title: At Victims School, Shock, Sorrow and Nightmares
description: TUCSON  For the children at Mesa Verde Elementary School, the questions are endless. First, they asked, again and again, why would a stranger kill Christina Green, who had attended school here since kindergarten? Then, some asked quietly, would that man come back to try to shoot them, too? And is it still safe to go to the supermarket?

title: Odette Lupiss Work as Photographer
description: A look back at the work of Odette Lupis as a freelance photographer.

title: Red Flags at a College, but Tied Hands
description: He was coming undone, that much is clear.

title: Messi, to His Surprise, Repeats as FIFA Player of Year
description: Lionel Messi was named FIFAs world player of the year on Monday, a worthy recognition of his talents but a surprising decision since neither of his teams, Barcelona and Argentina, won a major competition last year.

title: Amid Rioting, Tunisia Closes Universities
description: CAIRO  The Tunisian government ordered the closing of all schools and universities in the country on Monday until further notice in an attempt to quell escalating riots over poverty and unemployment.

title: Why Politicians Need to Stay Out in the Open
description: Washington

title: Charges Dropped Against British Protesters
description: LONDON  The unmasking of an undercover police officer who spent seven years infiltrating environmental protest groups in Britain and more than 20 other countries caused the collapse on Monday of a trial involving activists accused of planning to occupy and immobilize Britains largest coal-fired power station.

title: An Assault on Everyones Safety
description: The Glock 19 is a semiautomatic pistol so reliable that it is used by thousands of law enforcement agencies around the world, including the New York Police Department, to protect the police and the public. On Saturday, in Tucson, it became an instrument of carnage for two preventable reasons: It had an oversize ammunition clip that was once restricted by federal law and still should be; and it was fired by a disturbed man who should never have been able to purchase it legally.

title: Not So Cheap for China
description: While the Obama administration has been pressing China to stop artificially cheapening its currency, Chinese leaders still resist, insisting that that would damage exports and risk the countrys economic health and possibly its social order. Spiraling inflation  exacerbated by the cheap currency policy  could threaten both.

title: Mini Paceman: Ready for the Green Flag
description: Introduced on Monday: Mini Paceman concept

title: Corrections
description: NATIONAL

title: Lukashenkos Gulag
description: Belarus has long stood out as one of the most repressive of the former Soviet republics. Now we have fresh evidence of the cruel lengths to which its president, Aleksandr Lukashenko, will go to crush all challenges to his dictatorial rule. Jailing a leading opposition presidential candidate and the candidates wife, a journalist, was not enough. His government is threatening to seize custody of the couples 3-year-old son.

title: A Symbol of Hope for Haiti, a Landmark Again Stands Tall
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  A year after the earthquake that devastated Haitis capital, just 5 percent of the rubble has been removed. The National Palace still sits in a half-demolished pile. In its shadow, on the Champs de Mars plaza, tens of thousands of Haitians live under torn or frayed tents and tarpaulins. All over the city, buildings remain pancaked, keeled over, smashed  just as they were after the earthquake on Jan. 12, 2010.

title: A Whiff of Spring
description: Perhaps this is the year to plant oca and yacon. Or maybe pink blueberries, a double row of kohlrabi, and a patch of Galeux dEysines pumpkins. Anything is possible in January, when the seed catalogues have nearly all arrived. You can practically smell spring coming in their well-thumbed, dog-eared pages, where every cabbage, every cucumber, is perfectly ripe.

title: Judge Rules New York City Can Disclose Names in Teacher Rankings; Union Plans to Appeal
description: A Manhattan judge ruled Monday that the city may release performance rankings of thousands of teachers to the public, denying a request by the teachers union to keep the teachers names confidential.

title: Deep Social Services Cuts Outlined in California
description: SACRAMENTO  Workers were removing the ornaments from the Christmas tree at the Capitol here on Monday morning, and much the same mood filled the legislative chambers as Gov. Jerry Brown unveiled his Grinch-like budget.

title: 3 Fatally Shot in Separate Attacks Within 4 Hours
description: A 14-year-old boy and two men were shot to death in three separate attacks within four hours in the city on Monday afternoon, the police said.

title: Richard Winters Dies at 92; Led Band of Brothers
description: Richard Winters, the commanding officer of Easy Company, the Army unit whose gritty combat from the beaches of Normandy to the capture of Hitlers mountain retreat was recounted in the book and television series Band of Brothers, died on Jan. 2 in Campbelltown, Pa. He was 92 and lived in Hershey, Pa.

title: B.C.S. title game: No. 1 Auburn vs. No. 2 Oregon
description: The Tigers hold the Ducks offense in check, winning, 22-19, on a field goal in the final seconds.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,440 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Lobbyist Is Found Dead in Burned Car
description: A lobbyist for the energy industry was found dead in her sport utility vehicle early Monday. The lobbyist, Ashley Turton, 37, a regulatory affairs analyst for Progress Energy, which is based in North Carolina, appeared to have been backing out of her garage when her car hit it and caught fire. She is the wife of Daniel Turton, White House deputy director for legislative affairs for the House of Representatives. The authorities have not yet identified Ms. Turton as the driver, but her employer issued a statement on Monday saying she had died. Ms. Turton had served as the chief of staff for Representative Rosa DeLauro, Democrat of Connecticut.

title: Missouri: Ex-C.I.A. Officer Will Be Extradited
description: A federal judge on Monday ordered a former C.I.A. officer to be transferred to Virginia to face charges that he leaked classified government information to a reporter. The former officer, Jeffrey A. Sterling, 43, was indicted last month on charges that he shared restricted information about a secret government program meant to thwart unnamed countries weapons programs with a journalist, widely identified as James Risen of The New York Times. Mr. Risen wrote about a C.I.A. attempt to disrupt Iranian nuclear research in a 2006 book. That material did not appear in The Times. At a court appearance on Monday in St. Louis, not far from his home, Mr. Sterling, who worked for the C.I.A. from 1993 until he was fired in 2002, agreed to the transfer to Virginia, where the C.I.A. headquarters are located and the charges were filed.

title: Euros Architect Warns About Currencys Future
description: Even some architects of the euro are becoming pessimistic about its future.

title: Bump Technologies Expands and Raises Money
description: Bump Technologies makes an app that lets people bump their phones together to exchange things like business cards, photos and even money.

description: The former governor of Minnesota sits down with Michael Shear of the Caucus.

description: artless \rt-ls\ adjective

title: Looking Toward 2012
description: An interview with Tim Pawlenty, the former governor of Minnesota, who is eyeing a run for president in 2012.

title: Going From Yale to Sweden and Back to Reach No. 1
description: NEW HAVEN  When Keith Allain was a Yale undergraduate and the goalie for the mens hockey team, he majored in organizational behavior.

title: Afghanistan: American Aid Overseer Resigns
description: The American official responsible for overseeing how the billions of dollars in American aid to Afghanistan are spent resigned Monday, the White House said. The resignation of Arnold Fields, who was appointed special inspector general for Afghanistans reconstruction by President George W. Bush in 2008, comes weeks after he was criticized by some members of Congress as not having been aggressive enough in tracking how the money had been spent. A senior White House official said Mr. Fields had not been asked to leave. In Mr. Fieldss tenure, a White House statement said, his office produced numerous critical reports that have improved reconstruction efforts, and helped ensure that U.S. funded programs are achieving their objectives.

title: Bloggingheads: Violent Rhetoric
description: Mark Schmitt, left, of The American Prospect and Daniel Foster of National Review debate the connection between political rhetoric and the Arizona shooting.

title: A Revitalized Auto Show
description: After two of the worst years in industry history, automakers made a positive pitch at the 2011 Detroit auto show.

title: Twists, Turns and One Roll Give Auburn the Title
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  As polarizing as he is scintillating, and as charismatic as he is controversial, Auburn quarterback Cam Newton spent this college football season as the sports lightning rod.

title: Cave Drops Hints to Earliest Glass of Red
description: Scientists have reported finding the oldest known winemaking operation, about 6,100 years old, complete with a vat for fermenting, a press, storage jars, a clay bowl and a drinking cup made from an animal horn. Grape seeds, dried pressed grapes, stems, shriveled grapevines and residue were also found, and chemical analyses indicate red wine was produced there.

title: News Quiz | January 11, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Watching Jets-Colts With Trained Eye
description: EAST HANOVER, N.J.  The Jaguars Kevin Haslam sat watching the Jets 17-16 win over Indianapolis on Saturday night, not quite sure how the Jets were staying in the game.

title: Peter Yates, Filmmaker, Is Dead at 81
description: Peter Yates, a British-born director whose best-known films were well-observed tales of Americana, including the car-chase cop thriller Bullitt and the coming-of-age, bike-race comedy Breaking Away, died on Sunday in London. He was 81.

title: Debbie Friedman, Singer of Jewish Music, Dies at 59
description: Debbie Friedman, a singer and songwriter whose work  which married traditional Jewish texts to contemporary folk-infused melodies  is credited with helping give ancient liturgy broad appeal to late-20th-century worshippers, died on Sunday in Mission Viejo, Calif. She was 59 and lived in Laguna Woods, Calif.

title: The Feds QE2 Traders, Buying Bonds by the Billions
description: Deep inside the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, the $600 billion man is fast at work.

title: WikiLeaks Founder Said to Fear Illegal Rendition to U.S.
description: LONDON  Lawyers for Julian Assange, the founder of the WikiLeaks antisecrecy group, said on Tuesday that they would oppose his extradition to Sweden because he might subsequently face illegal rendition to the United States, risking imprisonment at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, or even the death penalty.

description: Test your vocabulary skills with todays question, created by Danielle Hoagland and Judith McCaffrey at Grammarlogues from the article Phys Ed: If You Are Fit, You Can Take It Easy.

title: Many in Brisbane Told to Evacuate as River Swells
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Brisbane, Australias third-largest city, braced for its worst flooding in 35 years early Wednesday, as flash floods from devastating rains that have been sweeping vast areas of the countrys northeast for weeks raced toward it. Officials urged many of Brisbanes two million residents to flee to higher ground.

title: Gates Warns of North Korea Missile Threat to U.S.
description: BEIJING  Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates warned Tuesday that North Korea was within five years of being able to strike the continental United States with an intercontinental ballistic missile, and said that, combined with its expanding nuclear program, the country is becoming a direct threat to the United States.

title: Simon Withdraws $4.5 Billion Offer for Capital Shopping
description: Simon Property said on Tuesday that it was dropping its offer to acquire Capital Shopping Centers  an outcome expected almost from the start.

description: Among the millions that entered America through the Port of New York in the 20th century, one group stood out in especially high relief. Some, in fact, were 17 feet tall.

title: Clinton Addresses Terrorism and Politics in Yemen
description: SANA, Yemen  The Obama administration wants to help Yemen do more than hunt down Islamic terrorists, Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton told this fragile Arab country on Tuesday as she sought to broaden a relationship almost wholly defined by American concerns that Yemen is a staging ground for plots against the United States.

title: Orkla in $2 Billion Deal With Chinese Chemical Company

title: Mike Pereira No Longer Supports Tuck Rule
description: NFL Rule 3, Section 21, Article 2, Note 2: When a Team A player is holding the ball to pass it forward, any intentional forward movement of his hand starts a forward pass, even if the player loses possession of the ball as he is attempting to tuck it back toward his body.

title: The Old Man and the Internet
description: I started out as a retailer. As time passed, I realized and struggled with the fact that I was also a manufacturer. Eventually, I expanded into being a distributor, a direct-sales organization and now a Web marketer. The first three evolutions were slow and painful, but I figured them out. This latest twist, becoming a Web marketer, is different. This time, it is not just about people and problems. Its about understanding the realities of a whole new world.

description: Over the next two weeks Anthony Tommasini is exploring the qualities that make a classical composer great, maybe even the best of all time. title: Why So Many Rich People Dont Feel Very Rich
description: Our post last week on whether the salary of Robert Gibbs, who is leaving his post as White House press secretary, is modest provoked some interesting reader comments. Several readers chimed in to say that even if it most likely placed Mr. Gibbs comfortably in the top 10 percent of earners, an annual salary of $172,000 probably didnt feel like a lot of money, given where he lives, similarly educated counterparts in the private sector, etc.

description: Of all the reasons to build fast, cool cars  to race, to create a halo effect or just to make tons of money  I had never heard this one: these cars are actually recruiting tools.

description: BAE Systems now plans to keep its aerospace unit, according to a company filing on Tuesday with the London Stock Exchange.

title: Subverting the Royal Film
description: Everything felt very proper  chin up, crusts off  at the lunch for The Kings Speech on Monday, held at a private club in Manhattan that resembled an English manor house, complete with a bust of Churchill and an actual Churchill, Edwina Sandys,granddaughter of that Britishprime minister, who said shed seen the movie three times. Tina Brown and Harry Evans were also there, along with Trudie Styler, Geoffrey Fletcher (the Oscar-winning screenwriter of Precious) and a sizable contingent of people who talked about literature, opera, and, one presumes, fox hunting or tea (or kinky sex). Also present, though less proper: Harvey Weinstein, who suggested a shot to the Baggers illustrious producer, Jeremy Beiler, whispering, Close-up! as our pal focused his camera. (Anyone who wondered whether Mr. Weinsteins filmmakers get final cut might have an answer now.)

title: Ready to See New York
description: Like all dutiful new arrivals on these shores, Josephine the baboon was equipped to record her visit in July 1957. She was on her way from Mombasa, Kenya, to the St. Louis Zoo, via the Bush Terminal in Brooklyn, where the freighter Lombok landed with bustards, dik-diks, elephants, giraffes, hippopotamuses, rhinoceroses, secretary birds, tortoises and zebras. The full tale  and 17 pictures from the archives  are on the Lens blog.

title: Vintage Jeans
description: There really is nothing new under the sun. On Thursday, The Master of the Blue Jeans opens at Didier Aaron in New York. Originally organized by Gerlinde Gruber, a curator at the Kunsthistorisches Museum in Vienna, for Galerie Canesso in Paris, the exhibition includes seven late-17th-century Italian paintings that show poor people dressed in denim fabric, which was made then in Genoa and known by the French name for that city, Gnes. The paintings, which had once been attributed to artists likeVelzquez and de la Tour, are now thought to be the work of a single, unknown artist. The catalog even has a brief essay by that 20th-century master of stonewash, Franois Girbaud. For more information, go to didieraaron.com.

title: Ailes Tells Fox Anchors to Tone It Down
description: Roger Ailes, the president of Fox News, on Monday embraced the idea of a more civil public discourse in the wake of the shootings in Arizona.

title: More Thoughts on Equality of Opportunity
description: Lots of good comments on this post. But I think theres a bit of an intellectual trap lurking here. As I pointed out, the typical conservative line about equality of opportunity, not results, really implies the need for a radical restructuring of our society, which doesnt offer anything remotely resembling equal opportunity. At this point, however, theres a tendency to think about what that restructuring would involve  and because its basically impossible, to throw up ones hands.

title: Wall Street Manages to Close Higher
description: The Standard & Poors 500-stock index on Tuesday rebounded from a three-day slump after Sears Holdings profit forecast and Lennars earnings beat estimates. Higher oil prices drove up energy shares.

title: Biden Assures Karzai of Aid From U.S. Beyond 2014
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. met with President Hamid Karzai here on Tuesday and promised a lasting American commitment to the country well beyond 2014, when NATO forces are scheduled to turn over security of the nation to Afghan forces.

title: Test of Stealth Fighter Clouds Gates Visit to China
description: BEIJING  Chinas military conducted a test flight of a new stealth fighter jet on Tuesday, overshadowing an important visit to Beijing by Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates aimed at improving defense ties  and apparently catching Chinas civilian leadership off guard.

She is clearly passionate about her work, as the Bagger discovered when we had this quasi-dialogue with her on the red carpet at the organizations ceremony on Monday night.

title: Blake Griffin: Playmaker Extraordinaire
description: It would be pointless for me or anyone else to declare Blake Griffins rookie season a rousing success thus far. Ridiculous statistical lines and metric tons of highlight reel footage tend to speak for themselves. Griffin has dunked and rebounded his way to mainstream appeal, a testament to his impressive abilities as a stat stuffer and the innate, almighty power of a rim-rocking slam.

title: The New Normal Is Actually Pretty Old
description: Everything old is new again, including normality.

title: Vain Glorious | Christine Chin Saves Face
description: If youve ever wondered why some women have skin that glows, it may be time to invest in the services of Christine Chin. A facialists facialist if ever there was one, Chin has figured out how to buff, squeeze and laser even the most recalcitrant skin into its best showing. Shes not been called Mean Christine for no reason: her facials are rigorous rather than soothing and may include the meticulous (and time-consuming) lancing of what she affectionately refers to as doughnuts  those sebaceous bumps under the skin that give it a regrettably bumpy appearance but are rarely bothered with by more massage-happy hands. Chins knowledge and expertise dont come cheap and her Orchard Street salon isnt cozy or even spacious, but shes worth the trek. And now theres another reason to seek her out, even if youve never tried her services: Chin has come out with a new line  the Christine Chin Celebrity collection  that reinforces her beliefs. The result of four years of closely supervised work with a Swiss lab, the products include Nano Gold, a new type of gold particle, as well as active plant cells from Sequoia, Blue Lotus and Argan. They range in price from $48 for the superb cleanser and toner to $120 for the debris-busting gommage. For the complete list of available products for sale online, go to christinechin.com.

title: Tuesday Reading: Paying for Good Grades
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

title: Notes to Commenters
description: 1. Obscenity will get your comment deleted; I suspect that a fair number of commenters dont even realize theyre doing it, because thats the way many of us #$%^! talk these days. But think about it, and dont waste your time or mine.

title: Live Blogging the Verizon iPhone Announcement
description: At an event in New York, Verizon Wireless is announcing a new addition to its smartphone lineup  Apples iPhone. It will be the second carrier in the United States to offer the phone; AT&T has had the exclusive so far. Members of the news media have been invited to Jazz at Lincoln Center for the unveiling. Stay tuned for updates as Jenna Wortham and I live-blog the press conference and relay information about data plans, pricing and multitasking.

title: A Green Racecar Driver With a Clean Conscience
description: DETROIT  Steve McQueen probably never lost sleep over his carbon footprint. Not so for racecar driver Leilani Mnter, a spokes-driver for Li-ion Motors. But she said her her relationship with Li-ion, an X Prize-winning Nevada electric-car company, helps her offset racing emissions.

title: Circular Logic and the Jets Prospects in New England
description: This is payback weekend in the N.F.L. playoffs, with every game a rematch of at least one regular-season meeting. Both of the divisional-round pairings in the A.F.C. (Jets-Patriots and Ravens-Steelers) are just that  divisional games. In the N.F.C., the Seahawks will try to repeat their October win in Chicago, and the Packers will try to avenge a November loss in Atlanta.

title: A Sequel for Argentine Noir?
description: The surprise winner in last years Oscar competition for best-foreign-language film wasThe Secret in Their Eyes, an Argentineneo-noir thriller starring Ricardo Darn. The Argentine submission this year? Carancho, a neo-noir thriller starring Ricardo Darn.

title: Spill Commission Issues Recommendations
description: A presidential commission has issued its final report on the causes of the Gulf of Mexico oil spill and laid out its recommendations. Here is John Broders article.

title: McKellen Re-Enlists as Gandalf for Hobbit Films
description: Hobbit fans can breathe a sigh of relief. Ian McKellen has agreed to reprise his role as Gandalf in Peter Jacksons two-picture adaptation of J.R.R. Tolkiens novel The Hobbit. Mr. McKellen portrayed Gandalf, the tall (especially when compared with a Hobbit) wizard in the Lord of the Rings trilogy, and garnered an Oscar nomination for best supporting actor in the first of the three films, The Fellowship of the Ring.

title: No More Mrs. Nice Mom
description: There was bound to be some push back. All the years of nurturance overload simply got to be too much. The breast-feeding through toddlerhood, nonstop baby wearing, co-sleeping, Baby Mozart co-watching; the peer pressure for never-ending singsong-voiced Mommy niceness, the ever-maddening chant of good job!; compulsory school involvement (that is, teacher-delegated busywork packaged as a way to Show Your Child You Care), the rapt attendance at each and every school performance, presentation, sporting event  the whole mishmash of modern, attuned, connected, concerned, self-esteem-building parenting.

title: On Chinese Mothers and American Kids
description: Perhaps the most talked-about story in parenting circles this week is Amy Chuas essay in The Wall Street Journal titled Why Chinese Mothers Are Superior.

title: Jumbo Mortgages: Price Differences Are Shrinking
description: If youre considering taking out a jumbo mortgage, now may be a good time to get the loan.

title: Just One Look | Nina Ricci Pre-Fall Collection
description: The Pre-Fall Collections, being shown in New York over the next several weeks, arrive in stores in May to fill the gap between bikinis and furs.Knitwear was a recurring theme at Peter Coppings pre-fall collection for Nina Ricci  charming, macaroon-hued cardigans and skirts for day and even a stretch wool and lace bustier gown for a big night out. This pink and red confection was inspired by 1950s-era couture. But slipping the sweater underneath, as Copping pointed out, makes it decidedly less cocktaily.

title: Renault to File Complaint in Suspected Spying
description: PARIS  The French carmaker Renault said Tuesday that it was preparing a criminal complaint regarding possible spying on its electric vehicle program that has led to the suspension of three employees.

title: Choosing Self-Esteem Over Sex or Pizza
description: Are young people addicted to feeling good about themselves?

title: Under the Radar: 5 Questions About Too Late! antigone (contest #2)
description: Two actors, one male and one female, growl like dogs, hit each other and perform other acts of aggressive gamesmanship in Too Late! antigone (contest #2), a radical retelling of the story of Antigone by the Italian company Motus. (The show, part of the Under the Radar Festival, is performed in English with Italian subtitles.) The actors barely have time to catch their breaths to deliver their lines before another physically demanding task  swinging from a rope, for example  begins. The audience has front-row seats.

title: Part 1: Answers to Readers Questions on Financial Aid
description: Now that most students applying to college for next falls freshman class have submitted their applications, they (and their families) will begin to tackle the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, or Fafsa.

title: Hedge Funds Pinched by Health Care Reform
description: Small businesses arent the only ones hit by the health care reform. Hedge funds, large and small, are feeling the pinch, too, at least according to one report.

title: Taking Off the Armor
description: I trembled when I felt the suction of the sterile brace over my right eyeball. The brightly lighted operation room faded to black as the blood ceased to flow. My left eye, still functioning for the time being, followed the surgeon with a paranoia I had not felt in months. My Army-sponsored Lasik eye surgery was supposed to be a relatively simple procedure. The surgeon would cut a flap into my cornea, imprint the prescription on its inner surface, and finally replace the flap with a few steroid drops. Id jump up, throw on some sunglasses, and would probably see 20/20 in a few days. But this wasnt what I signed up for.

title: The Jordan Hill Corollary
description: Can the talent evaluators of an N.B.A. team establish proper projections for a young player in only eight months?

title: What Were Reading
description: An aggregation of links by the reporters and editors of Diners Journal.

title: Jacobs Pillow Announces Lineup
description: To help shake off those winter doldrums Jacobs Pillow has announced the lineup for its annual summer dance festival in Becket, Mass. A world premiere by Jane Comfort, anniversary celebrations of the Trisha Brown Dance Company and the Mark Morris Dance Group, as well as the American debuts of two companies, 3e tage, comprising dancers from the Paris Opera Ballet, and DanzAbierta, a contemporary troupe from Cuba, are among the highlights of the festival. It will run from June 18 through Aug. 28 and include related events like an Annie Leibovitz dance photography exhibition.

title: Battle Is Set as Verizon Adds iPhone
description: Ending months of speculation, Verizon announced on Tuesday that it would begin selling Apples iPhone 4 early next month.

title: On Our Radar: U.S. Chamber Backs Growth of Fossil Fuels
description: The top energy official at the United States Chamber of Commerce, the powerful lobbying group, urges lawmakers to focus on expanding fossil fuel energy production, not high-cost energy sources like wind and solar. Having people really understand our energy reality, rather than energy as we would like it to be, is incredibly important, particularly at this juncture in terms of our economy, the official, Karen Harbert, a former high-level official at the Department of Energy under President George W. Bush, says in an interview. It may be lovely to think about a world without fossil fuels, but that simply is not Americas energy reality. [The Hill]

title: For All the Tostitos
description: If college footballs national championship game gave you a queasy feeling, you were not alone. There were the obvious reasons, including the fact that the winning teams quarterback was once shopped around by his father like a side of beef, drawing nothing more than an official N.C.A.A. shrug. Even those who chose to ignore the ethical dilemmas inherent in Auburns appearance and patiently waited through the epoch between the end of the regular season and the mythical title game were rewarded not with the promised offensive bonanza but instead with a rather grinding game with one signature play. They then endured ESPNs Brent Musburger proclaiming, This is for all the Tostitos.

title: More Votes, and More Deaths, in Southern Sudan
description: JUBA, Sudan  Ten civilians were killed along Sudans increasingly tense north-south border, Sudanese officials said Tuesday, as voting continued for a third day in a landmark referendum on southern Sudans independence.

title: Where Do All the Cabs Go in the Late Afternoon?
description: Ever feel as if you cant get a cab around 5 oclock? Now theres scientific proof that youre right.

title: Deal Could Help Asian Art Museum in San Francisco Fend Off Bankruptcy
description: The Asian Art Museum of San Francisco has been saved from likely bankruptcy as the City of San Francisco has persuaded the museums creditors, JPMorgan Chase and the insurer MBIA, to restructure its debt.

title: Fill-In | Snow Days
Answering Your Sudan Questions, Take 2
description: Former President Jimmy Carter and I are taking questions from readers about Sudan, the referendum now underway, and the regions future. We answered a first batch of questions a couple of days ago, and this is the second batch:

title: Red Wings Lose Osgood to Injury
description: Its been a roller coaster ride the past few weeks for the veteran Detroit Red Wings goalie Chris Osgood.

title: U.S. Chamber of Commerce Praises New White House Tone
description: There are further signs of thawing in the often fraught relationship between the White House and the U.S. Chamber of Commerce.

title: Live and in Print: Laphams Celebrities
description: What do you need to celebrate the publication of a highbrow journal devoted to celebrity? Highbrow celebrities, of course. Which is why Oskar Eustis, artistic director of the Public Theater, and the actors Philip Seymour Hoffman, Linda Emond and Mandy Patinkin are coming to Joes Pub on Jan. 20 for an evening devoted to the release of Laphams Quarterlys Winter 2011 issue Celebrity.

title: Mayor Promises Better Storm Response
description: Updated, 1:56 p.m. | Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg on Tuesday sought to reassure New Yorkers that the city would not fall short in its handling of a snowstorm expected to hit on Tuesday night.

title: Cinematographers Pan Across Generations
description: The American Society of Cinematographers announced its nominees late on Monday, and it was a nice mix of veterans and newcomers  although still all the films you would expect. Matthew Libatique (Black Swan), Wally Pfister (Inception), Danny Cohen (The Kings Speech), Jeff Cronenweth (The Social Network) and Roger Deakins (True Grit) got the nod. Mr. Deakins is the old hand of the group, having been nominated nine times and won twice, for The Shawshank Redemption in 1995 and The Man Who Wasnt There in 2002. Mr. Deakins will also receive a lifetime achievement award. Mr. Pfister has been recognized before, and Mr. Cohen, Mr. Cronenweth and Mr. Libatique are all first-timers.

title: Two Former Senators Become Lobbyists  In Record Time
description: That didnt take long.

title: At Twelve, a Brief Chapter Ends
description: 4:00 p.m. | Updated Only three months after taking over as publisher of Twelve, a small imprint of Grand Central Publishing, Susan Lehman has been abruptly replaced, Grand Central said on Tuesday.

title: Terra Firm Plans to Appeal EMI Ruling
description: Terra Firma, the private equity firm controlled by Guy Hands, is seeking to appeal a Federal District Court verdict that blocked its effort to recover as much as $8 billion from its star-crossed buyout of the EMI Group.

title: Go for Broke | YSL iPad Case
description: Another day, another iPad fashion app. And, so it seems, another designer case, with everyone from Armani to Zegna trying to get into the digital action. YSLfirst released the ChYc iPad case in the brands signature black and is now offering a fire-red version, which is perfectly in tune with springs all-business envelope clutch. Its priced about the same as the midlevel Wi-Fi and 3G-enabled iPad, so be prepared to download $750 at your A.T.M. before skipping to a YSL boutique near you.

title: Q&A: Puerto Rico or Tortola for a 30th Anniversary?
description: My husband and I will be celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary this February. Could you recommend a special resort setting in Puerto Rico or Tortola? Puerto Rico because its close and Tortola because thats where we honeymooned. We are limited to the school break in February but do not want to stay at a resort overrun with children. Looking for a quiet beach/private pool, good food and wine. Any suggestions to help us mark this milestone? M. Rossi, Merrick, N.Y.

title: Slow Trip to the Altar for Saxelby and Martins
description: Locavores in love is how you could describe the newly minted engagement of Anne Saxelby, the owner of Saxelby Cheesemongers in the Essex Street Market, and Patrick Martins, the former head of Slow Foods New York chapter, who now owns Heritage Foods USA, an online market for heirloom meats and other products.

title: 20th Century Fox Names Ex-Disney Exec as Marketing Chief
description: To shore up its movie marketing operation, 20th Century Fox on Tuesday named Oren Aviv, a former top executive at Walt Disney Studios, to the position of chief marketing officer.

title: Former Analyst Pleads Guilty in Insider Trading Case
description: A former analyst for Primary Global Research pleaded guilty on Tuesday in connection with the federal governments widening insider trading investigation.

title: A Pre-Defense of Baz Luhrmanns Gatsby
description: In the interest of talking about something other than Jared Lee Loughner (about whose motives and madness we still know far too little to say anything conclusive), heres Ta-Nehisi Coates explaining why he doesnt hold out much hope for Baz Luhrmanns forthcoming Great Gatsby adaptation:

title: Wikispeed SGT01 Awaits an Angel
description: Introduced on Tuesday: Wikispeed SGT01 prototype

title: Private Loft Party for Designers: A Hot Detroit Auto Show Ticket
description: Film premiere-style searchlights and a long line for valet parking down Woodward Avenue on Monday night signaled the annual Designers Night party.

title: House Resolution to Reaffirm Democratic Principles
description: With all of Capitol Hills legislative business postponed in response to the shooting rampage in Arizona, the House will reconvene on Wednesday to approve a resolution honoring the dead and the wounded, praising the bravery of those who responded to the attack and reaffirming the bedrock principle of American democracy and representative government  the right to peaceable assembly enshrined in the First Amendment.

title: Dancers Union Objects to City Ballets Plan for Touring Troupe
description: 4:20 p.m. | Updated The dancers union has moved to block efforts by New York City Ballet to establish a smaller touring ensemble, saying it violates their labor contract. The union, the American Guild of Musical Artists, said thatCity Balletwas required to ask its permission if it wanted to tour with anything less than the entire company. City Ballet failed to ask permission, the guild said.

title: Hot Social Networking Site Cools as Facebook Grows
description: As Facebook was negotiating a half-billion-dollar investment from Goldman Sachs recently, MySpace, once the dominant Web site for social networking, was preparing to fire nearly half its staff.

title: Tougher Rules Urged for Offshore Drilling
description: WASHINGTON  The presidential panel investigating the 2010 oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico recommended on Tuesday that Congress approve substantial new spending and sweeping new regulations for offshore oil operations at a time when the appetite for both is low.

title: Ford Graffiti Wall an Unlikely Diversion at Detroit Auto Show
description: DETROIT  The distinctive sound of aerosol spray cans could be overheard at the Ford Motor Company booth here, but nobody appeared concerned.

title: Yale Payroll Error Gives Gay Employees a New Year Surprise
description: Imagine that your employer sent you a letter just before Christmas informing you that it failed to withhold the proper amount of income to cover your 2010 tax bill, and would begin deducting that extra amount from your paycheck right after New Years.

title: Suspect Arrested in Shooting of Livery Driver
description: The suspect in the Dec. 3 shooting of a livery driver in Queens was arrested Tuesday morning in an apartment in Buffalo, the police said.

title: Just One Look | Giorgio Armani Pre-Fall Collection
description: The Pre-Fall Collections, being shown in New York over the next several weeks, arrive in stores in May to fill the gap between bikinis and furs.As designers amp up the showmanship this week  not to mention their collections  pre-fall is shaping up to become a fully fledged season. Giorgio Armani, however, kept things small and intimate. His collection of about a dozen pieces was inspired by the boudoir, a theme that revealed itself in coy glimpses of a pale pink suggestive of lingerie.

title: Aflockalypse
description: Portmanteau describing mass deaths of birds in the United States and Europe.

title: Some Motherly Advice From Kathie Lee Gifford to Snooki
description: On Tuesday mornings Today show Kathie Lee Gifford offered Snooki of Jersey Shore, a k a Nicole Polizzi, a little motherly advice.

title: Doctors Say Giffordss Condition Points to Survival
description: TUCSON  Just three days after a bullet passed through Representative Gabrielle Giffordss brain, and one day before the president was scheduled to come here to address the shooting rampage in which she was wounded, doctors said Tuesday that Ms. Giffordss chances of survival were certain. She is able to breathe on her own, although she remains on a ventilator as a precaution.

title: Cox Merges Adify and Cross-Media Units
description: The Internet age in marketing has been going on long enough that familiar names in online advertising are starting to go the way of Packard, Benton & Bowles and Colliers.

title: Growing Up and Old in the Same Little Neighborhood
description: When John Maloney was a teenager growing up in Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn, his friends started calling him Moe. It was short for Maloney. He liked the nickname. His mother had a different opinion.

title: Pictures of the Day: Sudan and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Sudan, Ivory Coast and Australia.

title: Goldmans New Financials Look Similar to Old
description: Goldman Sachs, whose operations have been called a big black box, is aiming to give investors and analysts more information in its newly redesigned financial statements.

title: Where All School Days Are Snow Days
description: MINTURN, Colo.  Off a remote road, the school in this tiny mountain town looks like any other small-town public school. Inside, high school and middle school students pass rows of lockers in the hallways, study in classrooms and conduct experiments in science laboratories.

title: Miles to Stay as Coach of L.S.U.
description: All is well again with Louisiana State and its football coach, Les Miles, or at least until the next loss stirs up the Tigers faithful. Miles said Tuesday that he would stay at L.S.U., turning away overtures from Michigan Athletic Director Dave Brandon, a former teammate of Miless at Michigan.

title: Mach7 Motorsports Falcon Wears Its Inspirations in Carbon Fiber
description: Introduced on Tuesday: Mach7 Motorsports Falcon

title: Mug Shots, Bedbugs and Celebrity Chicken Wings
description: A selection of Web nuggets for your pleasure.

title: Foreigners Shun Europes Bonds, and Debt Piles Up
description: ATHENS  Greece. Ireland. And now, it seems, Portugal.

title: 2 Arrested as Spain and France Move Against ETA
description: MADRID  The Spanish government underlined its determination to dismantle the Basque separatist group ETA on Tuesday with the arrest of two people in raids coordinated between the Spanish and French police, a day after a cease-fire offer from ETA.

title: Christian Is Killed in Shooting on Train in Egypt
description: CAIRO  A gunman jumped aboard a train heading toward the Egyptian capital on Tuesday and opened fire on passengers, killing one Christian man and injuring five other Christians, the Interior Ministry said.

title: Jack London Dies Suddenly On Ranch
description: SANTA ROSA, Cal. Nov. 22.--Jack London, the author, died at his Glen Ellen, Cal., ranch near here at 7:45 o'clock tonight, a victim of uremic poisoning. London was taken ill last night and was found unconscious early today by a servant who went to his room to awaken him.

title: Suffragists Lose Fight In The House
description: Washington, Jan. 12 -- Woman suffrage was discussed from every point of view for more than ten hours in the house today. At the close of the debate the proposed constitutional amendment giving nation-wide suffrage to women was rejected by the overwhelming vote of 174 - 204.

title: Save the Date: State of the Union on Jan. 25
description: The House speaker, John A. Boehner of Ohio, on Tuesday officially invited President Obama to deliver a State of the Union address on Jan. 25. The invitation, of course, is a formality given that the nation has long come to expect the annual address. And yet, it is a brief reminder that the president and Congress represent separate, coequal branches of government  and that Mr. Obamas appearance in the House is by invitation, not by demand.

title: Iraq and Kuwait Remain at Odds After Shootout
description: BAGHDAD  The Iraqi government is investigating a shootout on Monday between an Iraqi fishing boat and a Kuwaiti Coast Guard vessel in the Persian Gulf that left a Kuwaiti serviceman dead and five fishermen briefly in Kuwaiti custody, a spokesman for the Iraqi government said on Tuesday.

title: N.H.L.s Top-Secret Concussion Quiz
description: Sidney Crosby has been ruled out for at least a week because of a concussion that may (or may not) have happened during the Winter Classic against Washington. Thats led to plenty of controversy, as observers wonder whether he should have been allowed to play against Tampa Bay before announcing that hed take time off because of the concussion.

title: Ross G. Harrison, Yale Zoologist, 89
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 30--retired director of the Osborn Zoological Laboratory of Yale University and a pioneer in the embryonic transplantation and culture of animal tissue outside the organism, died at his home here today. He was 89 years old.

title: Wilder Sworn In as Virginia's Governor
description: Richmond, Jan. 13 -- Lawrence Douglas Wilder, a grandson of slaves, was sworn in today as Governor of Virginia in a 30-second ceremony that changed the political face of the United States.

title: More Play, Please, for Kindergartners, Parents Ask
description: Some kindergarten parents at Public School 101, a graceful brick castle in Forest Hills, Queens, wanted more free play time for their children  so they made a fuss.

title: Christie Calls for More Cuts and Big Changes to Schools
description: TRENTON  Gov. Chris Christie signaled Tuesday that his second year in office will be as full of conflict and wrenching change as his first, calling for more deep cuts in state spending and public employee benefits, and a broad education overhaul that quickly drew scorn from Democrats.

title: Albert Schweitzer, 90, Dies at His Hospital
description: LAMBARENE, GABON, Sept. 5--Albert Schweitzer died last night in his jungle hospital here. He was 90 years old.

title: ROOSEVELT, CHURCHILL MAP 1943 WAR STRATEGY AT TEN-DAY CONFERENCE HELD IN CASABLANCA; GIRAUD AND DE GAULLE, PRESENT, AGREE ON AIMS
description: CASABLANCA, French Morocco, Jan. 24 (Delayed) -- President Roosevelt and Prime Minister Churchill today concluded a momentous ten-day conference in which they planned Allied offensives of 1943 aimed at what the President called the "unconditional surrender of the Axis powers.

title: Crashed Electric Volvo C30 Displayed at Detroit Auto Show
description: DETROIT  What happens when an electric car hits a wall at 40 miles an hour? For the answer, Volvo crashed one.

title: For Boehner, Rampage Imposes Its Own Agenda
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker John A. Boehner expected to spend his first celebratory weeks as the new leader of the House showcasing his partys differences with the Democrats.

title: An Excerpt From 'Tosca'
description: Sondra Radvanovsky sings the aria "Vissi d'arte" from Luc Bondy's production of Puccini's opera. (Video courtesy of the Metropolitan Opera.)

title: For Auburn, Grimaces May Still Replace Smiles
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  Running from the field to the locker room after Auburns 22-19 victory in the Bowl Championship Series title game on Monday night, Auburn center Ryan Pugh raised his arms and screamed to no one in particular, They cant take that away from us!

title: Any Hotel Room in a Storm? Good Luck
description: For people hoping to wait out the storm in a hotel room in New York City, the headaches started the moment the forecasters started talking about snow. They discovered that reservations were hard to come by.

title: Martin Luther King Jr.: Leader of Millions in Nonviolent Drive for Racial Justice
description: To many million of American Negroes, the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was the prophet of their crusade for racial equality. He was their voice of anguish, their eloquence in humiliation, their battle cry for human dignity. He forged for them the weapons of nonviolence that withstood and blunted the ferocity of segregation.

title: GREEN BAY WINS FOOTBALL TITLE
description: LOS ANGLES, Jan. 15 -- Bryan Bartlett (Bart) Starr, the quarterback for the Green Bay Packers, led his team to a 35-10 victory over the Kansas City Chiefs today in the first professional football game between the champions of the National and American Leagues.

title: Fox Keeps Raising Hope Alive With Order for Second Season
description: One of Foxs new sitcoms this season, Raising Hope, will graduate to sophomore year.

title: Cook, Eat  Love? Learning to Prepare Nutritious Meals
description: Overview | Why dont people cook at home as often as they once did? How can home cooking help people eat more healthfully? In this lesson, students debate the merits of nutrition, economics, quality-of-life and taste when it comes to home cooking and restaurant meals. They even roll up their sleeves to make a salad, stir-fry or grain dish, recipes the Times food writer Mark Bittman claims will make a home cook out of anyone.

title: Space Capsule
description: Coco Chanel once dismissed Paco Rabanne as the steelworker of fashion, for his use of metal in his stubbornly futuristic designs. Rabanne, who is responsible for some acidic put-downs of his own, certainly lived up to the moniker with his ubiquitous chain mail dresses of the 1960s. Less known, however, is his 69 bag from a collection of that year. Celebrating the designers enduring vision of fashion, Comme des Garons has teamed up with Paco Rabanne to release nine variations on the bag, including versions in clear, acrylic Perspex, pink metallic suede, and black rubber. This is one chain mail youll be happy to receive.

title: Tosca, With Tinkering, Cooler Tempers and a Fill-In Tenor
description: If dull and uneven, with flashes of insight, is preferable to frustrating, then the Metropolitan Operas current production of Puccinis Tosca, created last season by the Swiss director Luc Bondy and revived on Monday night, showed a marked improvement over its initial run. At its opening night in 2009, the staging was lustily booed by the audience and denounced by most critics. Revived in April 2010 with a starry new cast  and without Mr. Bondys direct supervision  the notorious production was deemed a qualified success by many audience members and critics.

title: After Tucson, Parents Wonder What If
description: With Jared Lee Loughners unhinged grin staring out from so many Web sites and newspapers today, parents of troubled young adults are stepping forward, giving glimpses into the pain and impotence that comes when your child has mental illness.

title: Answers About Getting Organized
description: Barbara Reich, a professional organizer who was the subject of a recent Metropolitan article by Elissa Gootman, is taking readers questions this week about getting organized. You can ask a question here or find previous and subsequent installments in this Q & A here.

title: With Verizon, Will Apple Take a Bite of More Enterprise?
description: Few companies could command as much attention for bringing an existing phone to a new telephone network as Apple, whose iPhone is coming to Verizon Wireless.

title: After Recruiting Violations at Tennessee, a Neophyte Hits the Trail
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn.  Inside Thompson-Boling Arena, Jason Shay, an assistant with the Tennessee mens basketball team, looked down at his standardized letter jacket with the orange T embroidered on the front. It might not be orange enough, he thought, for his recruiting adventure over the next five and a half months.

title: Monacos Venturi Reveals E.V. Buggy
description: Introduced on Tuesday: Venturi America concept

title: A look Inside the Belly of the Blizzard
description: Years ago, I pushed the idea of developing a reality-TV show, Extremities, on science at the edge of whats possible, sort of Mythbusters with a rotating cast thatd include biologists climbing cliffs in Greenland to study nesting falcons, the team I joined on the sea ice near the North Pole and  certainly  scientists driving around Oswego, N.Y., with portable Doppler radars to plumb the innards of storms that produce that regions astounding lake-effect snow, one result of which is depicted in this photo (NOAA):

title: Geography Lessons
description: Best snark about the euro crisis yet from Satyajit Das, who suggests that European leaders, as part of their educational mission, are giving us geography lessons. First they told us that Ireland wasnt Greece; then they told us that Portugal wasnt Ireland; now theyre telling us that Spain isnt Greece, Ireland, or Portugal; soon the Belgians will be improving our spelling, telling us that theres no B in PIGS.

title: Reviewing Ciano
Ciano
description: THERE are two remarkable things going on at Ciano, the casual, new-style Italian restaurant that Shea Gallante opened a few months ago on East 22nd Street.

title: TimesCast | January 11, 2011
description: Doctors give the latest on Representative Gabrielle Giffords; lawmakers weigh new security measures after Saturday's shooting; and Verizon announces it will sell the iPhone.

title: Detroit to Reside on Broadway
description: Detroit, a new play about American dissipation with some deliciously tart roles, set in the adjacent backyards of two recovering addicts and their anxious middle-class neighbors, will be produced on Broadway in early fall of 2011 under the direction of Austin Pendleton, the producers announced on Tuesday. No casting was announced for the five-character play, which will mark the Broadway debut of the playwright Lisa DAmour, a well-known downtown writer and artist. The Steppenwolf Theater Company in Chicago produced Detroit last fall, which included Laurie Metcalf (November on Broadway, Roseanne on ABC) as the middle-class wife. The lead producers will be Jeffrey Richards, Jerry Frankel and Debbie Bisno, in association with Steppenwolf; Mr. Richards and Mr. Frankel previously teamed with Steppenwolf for its transfers of August: Osage County and Superior Donuts to Broadway. Performance dates and a theater will be announced later.

title: On Flatbush Avenue, Seven Stories Full of Ideas
description: When Al Attara bought a former bank on Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn 32 years ago for under $250,000, he envisioned it as a complex in which artists, architects and furniture designers would work side by side and share ownership of the 45,000-square-foot space.

title: House of Ideas in Brooklyn
description: A seven-story building in Flatbush is home to artists, architects and entrepreneurs, and creativity abounds.

title: Just One Look | Lanvin Pre-Fall Collection
description: The Pre-Fall Collections, being shown in New York over the next several weeks, arrive in stores in May to fill the gap between bikinis and furs.Alber Elbaz opened his pre-fall show with an observation: more women, he says, are wearing evening clothes during the day. The collection that followed might very well be the stuff of self-fulfilling prophecy. An ivory silk floor-length skirt, for example, took on the ease of trousers when paired with a thick ribbed sweater. But the best looks swung the other way, too. Here, a blouse and tweed skirt  daytime staples  are gussied up with bronze Lurex and a dollop of fur. (The wolf is optional.)

title: The Anti-Banter Bartender
description: WITH its pyrotechnics, suspenders and tattoos, the cocktail scene in New York appears, at times, to revolve around a troupe of Barnum & Bailey escapees. But those who frequent Weather Up, a Prohibition-style cocktail lounge, need not worry. Its 34-year-old namesake and owner, Kathryn Weatherup, is tall and blond, an unbearded lady. She is what, in some circles, is called a tall drink of water. Although here, a sloe gin fizz might be more appropriate.

title: A Move, and Early Bird Specials, for Rock of Ages
description: The 80s hair-band musical Rock of Ages, which closed on Sunday at the Brooks Atkinson Theater, will offer an unusual way to get discounted tickets when it resumes performances at the Helen Hayes Theater on March 24, producers announced on Monday.

title: A Reprieve for Max Fish
description: Several weeks before its doors were scheduled for shuttering, Max Fish has been granted a reprieve. Monday afternoon, a lease extension was finalized giving the venerable Lower East Side bar another year at its Ludlow Street location. The extension, which maintains the terms of the current lease, is the result of an agreement between Arwen Properties and the bars owner, Ullie Rimkus. The lease now ends Jan. 31, 2012.

title: As Big-Game Noise Turns Up, the Patriots Speak Softly
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Poor Alge Crumpler. He spent the first nine years of his career in relatively tranquil N.F.L. outposts like Atlanta and Tennessee, where opposing coaches do not heave Molotov cocktails about their next opponents study habits, where a playoff game is not reduced to a personal grudge match between two people who have more reason to compare their fleece separates than their 40-yard dash times, where the entertainment options preferred by the star quarterback are not scrutinized and discussed on an endless talk-radio loop.

title: Pictures of the Day: Sudan and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Sudan, Ivory Coast and Australia.

title: N.Y. Judges, Angry on Pay, Seek Union-Like Group
description: In late November, the State Legislature created a commission to decide whether New York States 1,300 judges should get a pay raise after 12 years without one. Court officials hailed the move as the end of one of the longer standoffs in Albany, and predicted that it would calm the states judges, who have sometimes simmered with fury over the issue.

title: Bill Clinton Says Political Tone Must Change
description: Former President Bill Clinton on Tuesday waded into the debate about Americas political rhetoric in the wake of last weekends shootings in Arizona, saying the tone of the national conversation must change.

title: Behind the Poster: Good People
description: In David Lindsay-Abaires forthcoming Broadway drama, Good People, Tate Donovan and Frances McDormand play a man and a woman who reunite after taking very different paths in life. The play takes place in Bostons traditionally working-class Southie neighborhood, where the two grew up and dated as teenagers.

title: For One Victim, Recovery Means Coping With Young Neighbors Death
description: TUCSON  It was not unusual for Suzi Hileman to shuttle children in her neighborhood from one event to the next. She particularly loved finding ways to introduce young girls to smart, strong role models. So it was when she took Christina Green, a 9-year-old neighbor, to meet Representative Gabrielle Giffords on Saturday morning.

title: The Art of Ailey
description: A look at the career of Judith Jamison, the artistic director of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.

title: Buzz Tracker
description: A sampling of whats making the rounds in the deal-making ecosystem:

title: Public Enemies
description: Brussels, January 26, 2008

title: Throwing Mud and Calling It Beautiful
description: One of the best neologisms to bubble up during the Internet era is moasting, a verb that combines the words moaning and boasting. Everyone moasts, sometimes, but media creatures on Twitter have perfected the form: Racing from Washington for a Charlie Rose taping. Whats happened to the quiet car on the Acela?

title: Still Connected to Rent, but Not Afraid to Branch Out
description: As Adam Pascal and Anthony Rapp, original cast members of Rent, joined voices to sing its anthem What You Own on Monday evening at Town Hall, the only thing that had dated about the song was its actual date. Youre living in America at the end of the millennium, goes this proclamation of survival in the age of AIDS. Youre living in America, where its like the Twilight Zone.

title: Transit Official Advises Against Unnecessary Travel
description: If you are worried about traveling around New York City on Wednesday morning, the chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority has a suggestion for you: dont.

title: Lilly Enters Diabetes Alliance With German Drug Maker
description: The pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly will pay $387 million to a German drug maker, Boehringer Ingelheim, as a first step in a global alliance to develop and market new diabetes drugs, the companies announced on Tuesday.

title: Snowfall Blankets Region and Snarls Flights
description: A ferocious winter storm that tore across the southeastern seaboard slammed into New York City overnight, forcing the cancellation of thousands of flights and threatening train, bus and rail service for millions of commuters across the region Wednesday.

title: Judges Grill Winklevoss Lawyer in Facebook Case
description: The scene: A marbled courtroom in the 1905 Beaux Arts building in San Francisco that houses the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.

title: For Gov. Rick Snyder, Little Competition for Detroit Spotlight
description: DETROIT  With all eyes on the bleak state of the Michigan economy, the states newly elected governor, Rick Snyder, addressed the press here on Tuesday.

title: Songs Say One Thing, Actions Another
description: You can absolutely judge a band by its covers, a cursory examination of the classics played on Monday night by the young country duo Steel Magnolia showed. There was After the Fire Is Gone, the Loretta Lynn-Conway Twitty lament; the feisty Stevie Nicks scold Stop Draggin My Heart Around; and Jackson, popularized by Johnny and June Carter Cash, which masks deep resentment beneath pep and winks.

title: Safe Harbors for Derivatives vs. Chapter 11
description: As I have noted before on DealBook, derivative contracts have a broad exception to the normal rules of bankruptcy, often called a safe harbor. Derivatives are not subject to the automatic stay, collateral collected on the eve of bankruptcy cannot be attacked as a preference, and derivative contracts are not subject to a debtors ability to assume or reject contracts unless the nondebtor counterparty consents.

title: A Ceremony for the Cantankerous
description: As awards ceremonies go, the New York Film Critics Circle is unique, in that  amid the thanking of producers and Columbia film professors, a sweet touch  there is always a bit of tension between movie people and the folks that judge them. Last year, even that master of off-the-cuff charm George Clooney got in a few jabs at Rex Reed.

title: Face-Lift for Mets Costume Institute
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art is planning a major renovation of its renowned Costume Institute. The project will enable the museum to show off part of its world-class permanent collection 10 months out of the year in a more contemporary setting.

title: After 80 Years, a Model A Motors Home to Detroit
description: DETROIT While automakers were busy giving last-minute shines to their rides in the Cobo Center here, Jonathan Klinger was double-clutching his way from northern Michigan to the show in a 1930 Model A Ford.

title: Beyond Hot Dogs and Pretzels in the Parks
description: The parks department wants to get better food into parks all over the city, Eater reports. The department is putting out a request on Wednesday for proposals from food vendors serving top quality food with menus that are inventive and interesting  and that incorporate ethnically diverse and/or healthy food choices. Food trucks, or in some cases food carts, would be able to set up in more than 50 locations in all boroughs. Here are the details of what theyre looking for and a list of the parks where the vendors can be located.

title: In Cupcake Chain, Decadent Dreams
description: As first reported by DealBooks Peter Lattman this week, the nations largest cupcake chain, Crumbs Bake Shop, will go public through a $66 million dollar merger with an investment company, the 57th Street General Acquisition Corporation. We spoke to Crumbs founders, Jason and Mia Bauer, about their plans to expand the chain to 200 stores nationwide by 2014.

title: In Cupcake Chain, Decadent Dreams
description: The nation's largest cupcake chain, Crumbs Bake Shop, has merged with an investment company and will go public. DealBook speaks to its founders about their plans for a nationwide expansion.

title: Send Us Your Videos of the Snow
description: December 2010 Blizzard Timelapse from Michael Black on Vimeo.

title: New Home for the iPhone
description: Sam Grobart, personal technology editor for the Times, talks about the problems and promise for the new iPhone.

title: Honoring Those Improving the Dying Part of Living
description: Humanity is both young and old right now, with a couple of billion teens and children and an explosively growing cohort of elderly, as well. Those in between form the ultimate sandwich generation as they increasingly find themselves caring for, or financially supporting, the helpless or ailing at both ends of lifes spectrum  both at the level of the family and the nation.

title: Stress, Pollution and Poverty: A Vicious Cycle?
