title: Grooming Linebackers the Steeler Way
description: DALLAS  Before he became one of the best linebackers in football, James Harrison was just another Pittsburgh Steelers project, a raw player plucked from practice squad anonymity so confused by the complexities of Dick LeBeaus defense that he would stop cold in the middle of a play, with no idea where to run as the action continued around him.

title: Screw Your Coreage to the Sticking Place
description: Back when I first tried to explain the logic of focusing on core inflation rather than headline inflation, I emphasized the distinction between goods whose prices fluctuate all the time and those whose prices are revised only occasionally; its the latter category that is subject to inflation inertia, and therefore where you have to worry that inflation or deflation can get baked into the economy, and become hard to undo.

title: Readers Questions: The Shingles Vaccine
description: I didnt realize how lucky I was, more than a year ago, when I simply trotted over to my family doctors office and got vaccinated against shingles. Having seen too many friends, younger and older, suffering with this painful disease, I considered immunization one of the benefits of turning 60, the age at which the vaccine is recommended. Happily, I didnt have to wait: My doctor had a supply on hand, and my insurance paid for the shot.

title: Ferrari, Sauber and a Pair of Lotuses Unveil Formula One Cars
description: On the eve of the 2011 Formula One racing season, four teams have issued gleaming letters of intent.

title: Is No Hedge Fund Too Big to Fail?
description: PALM BEACH, Fla.  One of the main things on the minds of hedge fund managers and others in the industry (aside from Egypt and insider trading) is the prospect of regulation.

title: Manhattan Theater Club Adds Extinction, Postpones Carls Sister This Season
description: Manhattan Theater Club has added The Extinction Method, a new play by Daniel Goldfarb about two couples who live in adjacent Brooklyn apartments, to its season. Sam Buntrock, who received a Tony nomination for his revival of Sunday in the Park With George, will direct the production, which begins previews on May 10 and opens on May 25 at New York City Center  Stage I.

title: Kings Speech: The Film to Beat and to Bad-Mouth
description: LOS ANGELES  It is the kings to lose.

title: Present! Roll Call Continues for PCB Leaks
description: The latest school building in New York City where the federal Environmental Protection Agency has tested for leaks of PCBs from light fixtures found elevated levels of the chemical in all seven samples taken.

title: Hear No Evil, Suspect No Evil at an Arizona Gun Show
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs office released several videos this morning detailing the citys recent undercover investigation into the ease with which one can buy guns at a gun show in Arizona  even if you tell the seller you probably wouldnt pass a background check, and even in the wake of the Jan. 9 Tucson shootings.

title: Vegetable Casseroles for Frigid Nights
description: Cold-weather and winter vegetables lend themselves to comforting, bubbly baked dishes  and I dont mean the casseroles conjured up from cream soups tossed with overcooked meats and canned vegetables. Some of my favorite winter casseroles are gratins, which are baked until the edges and top brown. (The browned part, including the bits you like to scrape off the sides of the dish, are the gratine. Grater mean "to scrape" in French.)

title: The Thucydides Trap
description: The theory that American anxiety about Chinas increasing power might evolve into animosity and aggression.(After Thucydidess account of the causes of the Peloponnesian war.)

title: Michelle Obama, First Lady of Fashion
description: Is she or isnt she? A closet clotheshorse (despite her staffs reluctance to discuss the matter), enamored of Jimmy Choo kitten heels and Azzedine Alaa belts? Or is she a woman of great natural style, only one of the expressions of which is to be found in her collection of colorful cardigans and her passion for prints? Do we pay attention to her wardrobe as a way of understanding the larger arc of her character? Or are her clothes no more than a manifestation of a carefully constructed image, an attempt to put across a persona of individualism and confidence?

title: Soft Lyrics Set in Motion a Mad Crush
description: Just as Allison Pearsons 2002 best seller, I Dont Know How She Does It, proved she had perfect pitch for channeling a stressed-out working mom in hedge-fund-crazy London, so her new novel, I Think I Love You, shows she has the same gift for channeling an insecure 13-year-old in 1974 with a mad crush on the pop star David Cassidy. You know, David Cassidy of The Partridge Family  he with the Bambi eyes and feathered mop top, who was the love object of millions of young girls in that era of bell-bottom pants, platform shoes and Mary Quant eye shadow.

title: Republican Group Plans to Challenge Scott Brown
description: When Scott Brown was surging toward victory in the United States Senate race in Massachusetts in 2009, he earned the support  and money  of the National Republican Trust.

title: Whether Plowing or Serving Hot Chocolate, Some Find a Payday in the Snow
description: The line for Louis Migliore between moonlighter and entrepreneur this winter measures nearly five feet deep.

title: Kobe Bryant Takes Over, and Lakers Pay the Price
description: On Friday, the online basketball community was rocked by a fascinating conversation piece: Henry Abbotts thorough analysis (for TrueHoop, ESPN.coms flagship N.B.A. blog) of Kobe Bryants clutch performance. Abbotts well-reasoned work sparked a number of interesting discussions and responses concerning late-game execution, most of which centered on the reputation and production of Bryant himself.

title: Scientists See Dangers in Energy Drinks
description: With widespread alarm about deaths linked to alcohol-and-caffeine-laced commercial drinks like the fruity malt beverage Four Loko, its easy to overlook problems that may be linked to the so-called energy drinks that spawned them.

title: Gates Calls for a Final Push to Eradicate Polio
description: On Monday, in a Manhattan town house that once belonged to polios most famous victim, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Bill Gates made an appeal for one more big push to wipe out world polio.

title: A Mantra: No Crying in the CAT Scanner
description: I have not cried. Not once.

title: Two Pop Festivals Are Already Hits With Ticket Buyers
description: The new year has barely begun, but two big-event music festivals are already hits. Last week the Coachella Valley Music & Arts Festival  in Indio, Calif., with Arcade Fire, Kanye West, Kings of Leon and the Strokes, sold out less than a week after going on sale. And by Monday all of the three-day passes for Ill Be Your Mirror, the new event in Asbury Park, N.J., presented by the people behind the All Tomorrows Parties concerts, had sold out, three days after they went on sale.

title: Two Pop Festivals Are Already Hits With Ticket Buyers
description: The new year has barely begun, but two big-event music festivals are already hits. Last week the Coachella Valley Music & Arts Festival  in Indio, Calif., with Arcade Fire, Kanye West, Kings of Leon and the Strokes, sold out less than a week after going on sale. And by Monday all of the three-day passes for Ill Be Your Mirror, the new event in Asbury Park, N.J., presented by the people behind the All Tomorrows Parties concerts, had sold out, three days after they went on sale.

title: For Fund Managers, a Class in Raising Money
description: PALM BEACH, Fla.  So youre a hedge fund manager. Youve been around for five years, have solid returns but took a beating during the financial crisis that reduced your assets base to a little more than $1 billion from $2 billion. How do you raise money?

title: Nurturing Nests Lift These Birds to a Higher Perch
description: Amid all the psychosocial caterwauling these days over the relative merits of tiger mothers and helicopter dads, allow me to make a pitch for the quietly dogged parenting style of the New Caledonian crow.

title: Cuomo Calls Budget Process a Sham
description: ALBANY  For months, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has been raising alarms about the states more than $9 billion deficit. On Monday, he baffled many in Albany by saying the state did not really have a significant deficit at all.

title: Facebooks Groupon-Like Service Goes Global
description: Facebook is expanding its discount shopping service to five European countries and Canada as part of its push to help brands communicate with its users, Reuters reports in this video.

title: Disputed Reactor Design Moves Forward
description: Westinghouse appears to have won an important first round in a battle with critics over the radical design of the containment system for its new AP1000 reactor. A panel of senior safety advisers has told the Nuclear Regulatory Commission that with a few additional procedures and analyses, the design should be approved.

title: Consumer Agency Tightens Scrutiny of Baby Sleep Products
description: Three years ago, Dr. Bradley Thach, a professor of pediatrics at Washington University in St. Louis, published findings that had the potential to upend nurseries across the nation, and perhaps save some lives too.

title: New Orleans to Expand Streetcar Routes
description: Add to the list of post-Katrina comeback efforts from the City of New Orleans a circuit of new streetcar routes.

title: Thanks Uncle Sam, but We Already Have Lots of Diet Gurus
description: I must admit personally that I never read the dietary guidelines until I got this job.

title: From the Big Screen to the West End
description: LOS ANGELES Since were on a Kings Speech roll, lets continue to turn our attention to Tom Hooper, the films now much-lauded director.

title: Wanted: Space Visionary (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Keeping Up With Medicine (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Guardians of a Ritual (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Perpetually Amused (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Out of Camelot, Knights in White Coats Lose Way
description: When I look at my career at midlife, I realize that in many ways Ive become the kind of doctor I never thought Id be: often impatient, at times indifferent or paternalistic.

title: Federal Judge Rules That Health Law Violates Constitution
description: A second federal judge ruled on Monday that it was unconstitutional for Congress to enact a health care law that required Americans to obtain commercial insurance, evening the score at 2 to 2 in the lower courts as conflicting opinions begin their path to the Supreme Court.

title: King Clarifies Interest in Mets
description: If anyone knows the difference between having a dream and having a fantasy, its someone named Martin Luther King.

title: The Way You Wear Your Fat
description: Q. Does the body put on fat in actual layers, or does fat I accumulate now mix with body fat Ive had for years?

title: Buzz Tracker
description: Why No Lobbying Ban for All? Barry Ritholtz points out that a condition of the takeover of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac was a ban on lobbying and political activities, while the banks that were rescued had no such curb. It was business as usual on Capitol Hill, for the bankrupt banks and their highly paid shills. The Big Picture

title: Who Am I?
description: Who Am I?

title: Rethinking the Big Breakfast
description: Many dieters believe that eating a big breakfast will help prevent overeating at lunch and dinner. But new research suggests that how much or little you eat for breakfast doesnt change your eating at other meals.

title: Now Booking | One Fine Stay
description: Those of us with grand travel dreams have recurring travel nightmares as well  one of mine is of wheeling my suitcase through the endless corridors of a throbbing nightclub, unable to find my room. This dream tends to occur when Ive been staying at too many boutique hotels, and leaves me longing for an alternative thats as stylish, but more homey.

title: Huntsman to Step Down, Fueling Speculation About Presidential Bid
description: 6:11 p.m. | Updated Jon Huntsman, the United States ambassador to China, has informed the White House that he plans to step down in the next few months, further stoking speculation about his presidential ambitions.

title: In an Oil Price Gap, the Scent of Tar Sands
description: In case you havent noticed, oil prices in the United States differ from those in the rest of the world. Usually the variance is just a few dollars, but over the last few weeks the difference between West Texas Intermediate prices and Brent crude, which is sourced in Europes North Sea, has widened to about $10.

title: H.I.V.: Drugs Often Reserved for the Very Sick May Stem Mother-to-Baby Infections
description: Breast-feeding mothers infected with the virus that causes AIDS can pass it along to their babies. But this is much less likely if the women receive antiretroviral triple therapy, according to a new study  even when they are not yet sick enough to qualify for it.

title: Sorting Out the Uprising in Egypt
description: To the Editor:

title: TimesCast | January 31, 2011
description: The scene in Cairo and its surrounding neighborhoods; Al Jazeera's moment; and Nicholas D. Kristof on the Egyptian Army.

title: A Passport Is the Easy Part
description: Most business travelers head to places that are politically stable. Even so, preparing for an overseas trip involves much more than packing a bag, leaving an out-of-office message and e-mailing itineraries to family members.

title: A Harlem Cultural Hub Is Threatened by Debt
description: Theirs was a partnership built on vision and pride and rooted in a building at the very heart of black America.

title: A Home Treatment Kit for Super Bowl Suffering
description: Every year scientists report that watching the Super Bowl is somehow unhealthy, even dangerous. Large bowls of snacks encourage overeating. Traffic accidents may increase after the game, too.

title: New Cars Unveiled for Formula One Season
description: Yes, this is a big week. The first tests of the new year begin in Valencia, Spain, on Tuesday, and four teams unveiled their 2011 model racing cars on Monday. Ferrari beat the others to the punch by introducing its new model last week.

title: New Cars Unveiled for Formula One Season
description: Yes, this is a big week. The first tests of the new year begin in Valencia, Spain, on Tuesday, and four teams unveiled their 2011 model racing cars on Monday. Ferrari beat the others to the punch by introducing its new model last week.

title: With Egypt in Crisis, Anchors Head to Cairo
description: As the uprising in Egypt approaches the one-week mark, television networks based in the United States continue to send reporters to the region. Now it appears some of the big network anchors are arriving there, as well.

title: Scenes From an Afterparty
description: LOS ANGELES The reputation of the Screen Actors Guild parties is that theyre loose and uninhibited affairs, actors having been known to enjoy a celebration or several hundred after the SAG Awards. The traditional first stop is the People magazine afterparty, held in a tent adjacent to the Shrine Auditorium, where the award ceremony takes place. With the mix of TV and movie stars, it had the feel of a high-gloss reunion, with both a band and a D.J., and buffets for starving performers, who mostly went around congratulating each other and admitting their fandom. (It is the season of back-patting, after all.)

title: From Tropical Vacation to Cold Reality
description: Monica Ferrell was in stockings, a skirt and heels. And she was clawing, helplessly, at the dirty, sandy, icy snow that clung to her Saab 9-3.

title: Concierge Medical Care With a Smaller Price Tag
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When Jennifer Contreras went to see her new physician, she had hardly arrived in the waiting room before she was called in  by the doctor herself.

title: Crisis Management for Travelers in Egypt
description: WHATS it worth to you to get your people out of Egypt? Someone probably once asked Moses a similar question. Now, companies that need to get their business travelers out  and cant count on the parting of the Red Sea  are doing whatever it takes.

title: Vain Glorious | Edible Beauty
description: If youre the owner of a gym or the purveyor of a cleanse delivery service, its most certainly still the most wonderful time of the year, as us poor slobs who ate too many sweets and drank too much bubbly over the holidays amble back to work determined to shed the weight we gained by the time the snow melts. (In case you havent heard, theres a sheer trend for spring.) These new nutraceuticals (ingestible beauty products) aim to help you do just that, and you may even forget youre not drinking soda or eating candy.

title: The Most (and Least) Expensive Vehicles to Insure
description: The Mercedes SL65 AMG roadster is the most expensive 2011 model vehicle to insure, according to a new ranking of average premiums for 2011 models that Insure.com released earlier this month.

title: Seventh Day of Protests in Egypt
description: Photos From the Protests in Egypt, Jan. 31, 2011

title: High Jewelry Heralds Nature and Technology
description: Technology is giving high jewelry brands new avenues for self-expression.

title: U.S. and Europe Move Against Belaruss Leader
description: MOSCOW  The United States and the European Union on Monday imposed sanctions against President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko and scores of other officials in Belarus for a broad crackdown on the opposition after the fraudulent presidential election late last year.

title: Lender Disputes Kabul Banks Losses
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan Central Bank on Monday sharply disputed accounts by The New York Times and several other publications that Afghanistans largest bank had hundreds of millions of dollars more in losses than previously publicized. In a statement and a news conference it said that Kabul Bank, the countrys largest, had a bright future.

title: Off the Menu: David Burke Kitchen
description: David Burke is opening his first downtown restaurant on Thursday, David Burke Kitchen, in SoHo.

title: Wyoming Senator Seeks to Lasso E.P.A.
description: Senator John Barrasso, Republican of Wyoming, introduced legislation on Monday to block the Environmental Protection Agency from taking any action to regulate greenhouse gases to address climate change. His broadly written bill is one of several assaults on the E.P.A.s regulatory authority that will be coming from Republicans and coal-state Democrats in both houses of Congress in coming days.

title: Hype Central: On the Road to Nirvana
description: For fans of mass-media meta-irony, Super Bowl week is like Christmas morning. No other event generates more sheer coverage about the amount of sheer coverage being generated.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Egypt, Bangladesh, Somalia and Russia.

title: Wary of Egypt Unrest, China Censors Web
description: BEIJING  In another era, Chinas leaders might have been content to let discussion of the protests in Egypt float around among private citizens, then fizzle out.

title: AOL Founder to Lead White House Small-Business Effort
description: Steve Case, the founder of AOL, will lead panel of business executives who will encourage private investment in small, entrepreneurial start-ups, the White House announced Monday.

title: Where Friendship and Love Find Their Common Ground
description: The latest example of the genre that might be called successful television writer tries the New York stage comes from Joel Fields, whose long list of producing and writing credits for TV includes Ugly Betty, Commander in Chief and Rizzoli & Isles. The play is How I Fell in Love, and its a pleasant enough romance. Just not a very ambitious one.

title: Readers Debate the Concept of Race
description: Is race an imaginary category that should be thrown out? Yes, proclaimed many readers who commented on Susan Saulnys article about the increasing number of Americans who identify as mixed-race.

title: On Thinking Too Much About Policy
description: So I saw an email in my inbox titled revolving door, and I just assumed it was about Evan Bayhs move to K Street or something like that. And I set it aside, because I didnt feel like reading even more about the corruption of our system.

title: A Look at Mohamed ElBaradei
description: David E. Sanger, The Times's chief Washington correspondent, talks about Mohamed ElBaradei's prospects as a leader in Egypt.

title: Businesses Take Flight, With Help From NASA
description: BOULDER, Colo.  Sitting in a testing facility at the University of Colorado, the inner shell of the Dream Chaser space plane looks like the fuselage of an old DC-3.

title: Safety Resources on Child Sleep Products
description: As I report in an article today, the Consumer Product Safety Commission has decided to take a deeper look at the hazards of an extensive line of baby sleep products blamed for injuries and deaths.

title: The Administration Starts Its Start-Up Policy
description: First came the Obama administrations embrace a week ago of corporate America, by naming Jeffrey Immelt, chief executive of General Electric, head of a White House advisory board, the Council on Jobs and Competitiveness.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Egypt, Bangladesh, Somalia and Russia.

title: Serving Otter, Beaver and God Knows How Many Muskrats in the Bronx
description: The e-mailed invitation promised the most exclusive secret dining event of the new year. Held on Saturday at the abandoned old Bronx Borough Courthouse, a Beaux Arts building decaying from years of disuse, the First Annual Bronx Pipe Smoking Society Small Game Dinner was devoted to sampling small woodland creatures.

title: Afghan Stoning Video Rekindles Outcry
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Police officers investigating the double murder of a couple who were stoned to death in a prominent case five months ago could hardly have asked for more abundant evidence.

title: Nicholas D. Kristof in Cairo
description: The Op-Ed columnist Nicholas D. Kristof talks about what to expect from Tuesday's protests in Cairo.

title: Does One Need Sight to Grasp the World?
description: It takes two hours to watch Molly Sweeney at the Irish Repertory Theater. But youll spend much more time thinking about it afterward. A deeply moving meditation on hope, change and despair, its a compelling piece of theater, one in which the ending applause is only the beginning of the plays effects.

title: Romney Outpaced Potential Rivals in 2010 Fund-Raising
description: As the field of Republican presidential contenders slowly begins taking shape, with prospective candidates working behind the scenes to line up financial contributors, the final fund-raising tallies from last year provide a good starting point for 2012.

title: A Windfall in Cardboard
description: BALTIMORE  The School Sisters of Notre Dame imagine that there is a special place in heaven for the man who helped their Roman Catholic orders international teaching and ministry and its work with the poor.

title: Bringing the Fourth of July to Israel
description: OUR team at GlobeTask in Jerusalem is very tight. I was born in Detroit, and most of my colleagues are Americans, too.

title: Pro Bowl Lifts Fox
description: Coverage of the N.F.L. Pro Bowl lifted Fox to No. 1 in the ratings on Sunday evening, while CBS finished close behind with strong ratings for its made-for-television movie The Lost Valentine. According to Nielsens estimates, 14.5 million viewers tuned to CBS for the film, outperforming its competitors from 9 to 11 p.m. and delivering the largest audience for a Hallmark Hall of Fame broadcast in four years. Earlier, CBS drew 10.1 million viewers for 60 Minutes, featuring an interview with Julian Assange of WikiLeaks, and 8.1 million for a repeat of Undercover Boss. Fox was somewhat more consistent, averaging 12.4 million viewers for its football coverage.

title: Cairo Protests: Day 7
description: Reporters Anthony Shadid, Liam Stack and Stephen Farrell report on the state of unrest around Cairo.

title: Shovel That Roof, Before Something Bad Happens
description: The National Weather Service and the city are urging property owners and builders to clear rooftops, awnings and overhangs of snow ASAP, to avoid potential collapses when an ice storm is expected to hit New York early Tuesday.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,453 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It recently confirmed the deaths of the following Americans:

title: Ricky Martin, Now as Himself
description: The back story is upfront on Ricky Martins Msica + Alma + Sexo (Music + Soul + Sex), his first studio album since 2005 and his first since he announced last year on his Web site that he is proud to say that I am a fortunate homosexual man. On this album his usual exhortations to seize lifes pleasures mingle with coming-out manifestos, and he smiles through them all.

title: Likely Upswing in the Oil Patch
description: Major oil firms have become big spenders. Together, the top three American giants say they plan capital spending this year of about $60 billion, well above the year of peak crude prices in 2008, despite showing only tepid cash flow growth. At first blush, this looks like desperation, as Western oil companies increasingly struggle to replace crude reserves. But patient investors will find higher returns are on the way.

title: How a Hedge Fund Can Land a Whale
description: PALM BEACH, Fla.  Ash Williams, the hedge fund manager turned pension titan, has a host of suggestions for those firms hoping to land some big pension money. His most important advice: do your homework.

title: Kool Herc Is in Pain, and Using It to Put Focus on Insurance
description: Update, Feb. 2 | A medical relief fund has been set up for Kool Herc.

title: Volunteers Work to Keep Order in Chaos of Egypt
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt  At the first protest, on Jan. 25, Majd Mardini noticed that an ambulance could not get through the crowd of demonstrators. Outgoing, voluble and anything but shy, he began asking people to step aside, parting the crowd so the ambulance could get through.

title: In Crowds Euphoria, No Clear Leadership Emerges
description: CAIRO  In the tableau of revolution that Tahrir Square has become, the very passions that have inspired the protests here were countered Monday by a question that could determine whether President Hosni Mubarak relinquishes nearly 30 years in power: Who will speak for people who have never had a voice?

title: Experts Debate Limits of Fish Farming
description: Aquaculture is overtaking traditional fishing in global production, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization reported Monday. But a scientist with the organization predicted that growth would slow as space for the food farms dwindled and concerns grew about their effects on the environment.

title: A Violinist Layers Bach With Relative Newcomers
description: Pianists and guitarists often give solo recitals, while singers and most other instrumentalists invariably perform with piano accompaniment. But the intrepid violinist Jennifer Koh took to the stage alone for her concert on Sunday afternoon at the 92nd Street Y.

title: A Swede by Any Other Name. In Fact, Many Swedes.
description: STOCKHOLM  Martin Cervall believes that his grandfather was on the cutting edge of a contemporary trend in Sweden.

title: U.S. Cancels Friendly in Egypt
description: The United States has canceled a Feb. 9 exhibition match against Egypt in Cairo, citing the ongoing political unrest in that country.

title: A Snow Angel, Made by a Car
description: And now the final installment of todays Snowbound Vehicles trilogy. This was spotted on Seeley Street in Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn. Weve never seen one of these before, though we find ourselves wondering why not. Theyre certainly easy enough to make. Just park, snow, press and go!

title: $10 Million in Pay for Bank of America Chief
description: Brian T. Moynihan, chief executive of Bank of America

title: Gas Drilling Technique Is Labeled Violation
description: Oil and gas service companies injected tens of millions of gallons of diesel fuel into onshore wells in more than a dozen states from 2005 to 2009, Congressional investigators have charged. Those injections appear to have violated the Safe Water Drinking Act, the investigators said in a letter to the Environmental Protection Agency on Monday.

title: Line in Dance? Lets Go Back to the Drawing Board
description: Line in dance has two main meanings: one in space, the other in time. The Museum of Modern Arts exhibition On Line: Drawing Through the Twentieth Century, which prominently reflects the institutions new interest in dance, illustrates that. Youve hardly arrived when you see a film of Loie Fullers 1897-99 Danse Serpentine (II). In this the performer is never static; the billowing lines she makes with her costume are in perpetual change.

title: A Violin Concerto Was the Attraction, but a Serenade Had Seductive Power
description: The ostensible drawing card at the Orpheus Chamber Orchestras concert at Carnegie Hall on Saturday evening was an account of Prokofievs Violin Concerto No. 2, with Vadim Gluzman as soloist. Yet as fine as Mr. Gluzmans performance was, a workout that balanced thoughtfulness and visceral power, the most memorable performance of the evening came in an outlier: Krzysztof Pendereckis Serenade (1997).

title: Offering a Range of Songs, While Prizing Spirit Over Style
description: Revisiting musical roots, as maturing musicians often do, can lead to dutiful, preservationist renditions of old songs. But not for Robert Plant, 62, whose Band of Joy played on Sunday night at the Beacon Theater as if twanging and stomping were the route to revelation. The concert had nothing to do with period style and everything to do with spirit.

title: Bumbling in the Morgue: Blind, Drunk or Merely Incompetent Coroners
description: Lets imagine that an intruder entered your home one night and fatally poisoned you. Lets say that during the previous weeks or months you had evinced signs of emotional volatility. Perhaps you were even depressed. Lets go further and presume that you lived in one of the many places in America experiencing state and municipal budget crises. The police suspect suicide, but because the coroners office is underfinanced and understaffed  maybe there isnt even a place to refrigerate your body until someone can get around to dissecting your corpse  no autopsy is performed to confirm or invalidate those suspicions. A murderer is free and on to the next house and victim.

title: Illinois Governor Signs Civil Union Law
description: CHICAGO  Hundreds of people packed into a downtown ballroom on Monday afternoon to watch Governor Patrick J. Quinn, a Democrat, sign a law making civil unions legal for same-sex couples in this state.
